Original reporting focused on the trauma: without mentioning the motive of the boy's refusal to wear a dress.
The Office of the Attorney General: s statement about the boy's death did not mention clothing choice as a possible motive.
The Guanajuato Prosecutor: s Office denied the claim that the boy was killed for refusing to wear a dress and stated that there was no evidence to support this.
The initial reports of the boy: s death did not mention his mother's sexual orientation, but later rumors about the nature of his death arose after a report mentioned that his mother was a lesbian.
